message.content: {"id": "49195", "title": "Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message", "description": "Specify <Server port=\"1\" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried. ", "OB": "When using Tomcat as a Windows service and specifying 1 as the shutdown port in the server.xml configuration file, the service starts successfully but prints an error message.", "EB": "The error message should not be printed when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. Start the service, and then stop the service. Shutdown the server through an OS signal, like calling Catalina.stop()."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49195', 'title': 'Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message', 'description': 'Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Install Tomcat as a service on Windows2. Start the service, and then stop the service.4. Shut down server through OS signal. E.g., to call Catalina.stop(). '}
